info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 02 at 2:51AM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation becoming all snow Wednesday afternoon. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 5 to 15 below zero. * WHERE...West central Oklahoma. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia in a short amount of time if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In areas of accumulating snows, blowing snow will create very low visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Oklahoma, call 8 4 4 4 6 5 4 9 9 7 for road information. In Texas, call 8 0 0 4 5 2 9 2 9 2 for road information.
